DOC.brief_summary: To provide information about the safety and efficacy of lanthanum carbonate in children compared to standard treatment.
DOC.brief_title: A Comparison of Lanthanum Carbonate and Calcium Carbonate in Children
DOC.criteria: 1. Aged 10 years to less than 18 years of age at the time of consent 2. Serum phosphorus levels as follows: Age less than 12 years: Serum phosphorus greater than 6.0 mg/dL (1.94 mmol/L) Age 12 years and older: Serum phosphorus greater than 5.5 mg/dL (1.78 mmol/L) 1. Unable to eat semisolid foods or on Total Enteral Alimentation 2. Serum PTH greater than 700 pg/mL 3. Serum calcium greater than 10.2 mg/dL (2.54 mmol/L)
